source.2c634ba2:
'''
 SF: 
 - I suggest something like noun1 instead of noun_one, since it is shorter
 - It is more common to put comments before doing whatever you are commenting on.
 You also don't need quite so many comments
 - I would prefer if you printed the whole story at the end, but this is alright
 - Instead of input("noun_one"), it would be good to ask something more human, like 
 "Give me a noun". 
 - Make sure you complete the planning and reflection and you include a number
 (cast it to an int or a float)
 # fixed my int and added my planning and refrection I also made my questions sound more human like.
 '''
 noun_one=input( "what is your noun")
 # put in a noun
 print("hellow fellow",noun_one )
 # this will say hellow fellow then your chosen noun
 verb_one=input("what is your verb")
 # put in a adjective
 print("today we will discuss how to",verb_one ,"people")
 # this will say today we will discuss your chosen adjective
 location_one=input("what is your location of choice")
 # put in a location
 print("this lesson will take place at",location_one)
 # this will say this lesson will take place at chosen location
 noun_two=input("what is your noun")
 # put in your second noun
 print("you will have to bring",noun_two)
 # this will say you have to bring your second noun
 adjective_one=input("what is your adjective")
 # put in your adjective
 print("you will have to be",adjective_one )
 # this will say you will have to be chosen adjective
 number_one=int(input("what is you number of choice"))
 # put in the number of your choice 
 print("remember to bring exacty",number_one,"people")
 #this will say remember to bring exacty your chosen number people
 verb_two=input("what is your verb")
 # put in a verb
 print("remember to",verb_two, "no one")
 # this will say remember to your chosen verb no one

source.ffd44fe2:
Requirement Description Points Earned
Originality All code is your own. Any code snippets that are not your own are properly cited. No more than 5 lines from any website. 15 points 15
Planning & Reflection The "make a plan" section includes a detailed description of how you plan to complete the project. Reflection is thoughtful and answers all required questions. 15 points 7
Compiles Code Compiles 10 points 10
Comments Code is properly commented 10 points 7
Conventions Naming and style conventions are approriate 10 points 9
Size/ Complexity Your story must be at least 5 sentences and ask for at least 5 pieces of user input 10 points 10
Variables Each piece of user input is stored as a variable. At least one variable is an int or a float. 15 points 15
Print At the end, the story is printed with user input 15 points 5

source.7bcd65b2:
---

"Final" Score: 78 / 100

SF: Good fixes! It is a little over commented right now. I would put one comment for asking for variables, and then one for printing story. Make sure you are collecting all variables by asking "Give me a noun" and *then* printing the whole story. Like when we did madlibs on paper. 

---

source.06f64e02:
You will be creating a madlibs story. 

Your task:
1.   Write a story with some blanks (at least 5)
2.   Ask the user to input a word based on its part of speech
3.   Once the user has given you all of the words, print your story with user input.
4. At least one input must be an int or a float

Want to make it better? You could...
*   Write a statement so that the proper "a" or "an" is used based on user input
*   Allow the user to choose between different story options
*   Add input validation so that only a number is given when a number is asked for
*   Use output formatting to make the printed story look nice
* Anything else!
source.f3f8881a:
Here, write a 1 paragraph reflection answering the following questions:

*   What was the hardest part of this project?
*   What was the easiesy part of this project?
*   How did you utilize your peer feedback?
* What was different between your plan and the final project?
* How well did you plan? Was your idea too easy? Too hard? Just right?
* If you had unlimited time, what would you add to this project?

To be honest the hardest part of this project was adding an int in. What I found to be the easiest was planning out my story. I planned on makng it all one line of code then realized how hard it would be and decided to do separate lines. I planned pretty decent and my idea was easy till I ran into puting an int into the story. If I had unlimited time i would have made the code and story one long line.

source.abc8da14:
Double Computers: 
* Include a mathematical operation. For example, you may ask an age and print how old they will be in 5 years
* Include at least 10 blanks. Use at least one part of speech more than once.
